alert.note: Alert for Logan; McDowell; Mingo; Northwest Raleigh; Southeast Raleigh; Wayne; Wyoming (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Frost Advisory issued April 24 at 3:12AM EDT until April 24 at 9:00AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FROST ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM EDT THIS MORNING... ...FREEZE WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...For the Frost Advisory, temperatures as low as 35 will result in frost formation. For the Freeze Watch, sub-freezing temperatures as low as 31 possible. * WHERE...Portions of northeast Kentucky, southwest Virginia and southeast, southern and western West Virginia. * WHEN...For the Frost Advisory, until 9 AM EDT this morning. For the Freeze Watch, from late tonight through Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...Frost and freeze conditions could kill crops, other sensitive vegetation and possibly damage unprotected outdoor plumbing.
info.instruction: Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. To prevent freezing and possible bursting of outdoor water pipes they should be wrapped, drained, or allowed to drip slowly. Those that have in-ground sprinkler systems should drain them and cover above- ground pipes to protect them from freezing.
